description: A cave and pit in an area used for chalk quarrying in the late Iron age. The cave is dated to the late 2nd CE and has been interpreted as a kind of 'pit-shrine'.
bibliography: Bake. “Investigation of an Iron Age Pit and Roman Cave at Spratling Court Farm, Manston,” 2006. http://www.kentarchaeology.org.uk/10/023.pdf.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Spratling Court Farm, Manston (Kent).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
